parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To use, make use of, deal with, take advantage of.
From boethos; aid; specially, a rope or chain for frapping a vessel.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To under-gird, as to strengthen a ship against the waves. From hupo and zonnumi; to gird under, i.e. Frap.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ship, vessel, boat. From pleo; a sailer, i.e. Vessel.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From ek and pipto; to drop away; specially, be driven out of one's course; figuratively, to lose, become inefficient.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From suro; a shoal, i.e. The Syrtis Major or great bay on the north coast of Africa.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To let down, lower, slacken, loosen. From the base of chasma; to lower.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A vessel, implement, equipment or apparatus (specially, a wife as contributing to the usefulness of the husband).
Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
